conclusion: Consider effects of light direction and shadow formation on objects.
Light source is positioned above objects, casting shadows on the ground.
When light source moves backward, it will cast shadows in a different direction.
Objects (hat, glove, calendar, peach) are positioned on the ground.
When light source moves backward, shadows will change in size and position.
Shadow of an object is formed by light source and object itself.
Size and position of shadow will change as light source moves.
Objects will move away from the light source.
Shadow of each object will move away from the light source.
Size of shadows will decrease as light source moves backward.
Size of objects will decrease as light source moves backward.
When light source moves backward, shadows become smaller and objects move away from light source.
